tweets.text:
Just received this from @EnvAgency

"...current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use WITHIN EXISTING LICENSED VOLUMES will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/1mnOuVTXt7

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and we need more engineers. 

Join us, @EnvAgency and @learnliveuk on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register here: https://t.co/UX0iukfGVl https://t.co/xvfBtzGXxo

Abysmal decision by @EnvAgency to let this go ahead. Someone explain the logic behind building an incinerator in the bottom of a valley and close to residential areas and schools. Logic not heard when money is talking. Shame on them.  https://t.co/qE33Ee3TjU

We are honored to have received two #FCExcellenceAwards today from @EnvAgency with our Building with Nature Indonesia programme. üéâ A big thank you to our government partners @kkpgoid @KemenPU, to @EcoShapeBwN all partners and to our donors @RVO_Duurzaam @minbuza and @iki_bmu https://t.co/zzLuKsaROP

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Great to see more leaky woody dams going in at the top of the catchment....all helping to slow the flow and increase habitats and biodiversity. #naturalfloodmanagement #nfm #slowtheflow #merrybrook @FWAGSouthWest @worcscc @Wychavon @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/5JQy7yzeVG

@Nickhod53168394 @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency extremely sad. as i learn more about the state of UK rivers i am increasingly shocked by the way that companies can pollute and damage nature with virtually no consequences

Some news! After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don‚Äôt go far- from today I‚Äôm our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! Can‚Äôt wait :) https://t.co/FkeIBPvdth

Works are progressing well on Phase 2 of the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme. 

Want to find out more? https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/xtscHQneV3

All year round we train for all kinds of #environmental incidents.

Here our #Warwickshire team have practiced with peroxide equipment to aerate water for fish during #pollution incidents / algae blooms.

Peroxide boosts O2 levels where there is a dip in dissolved O2 levels. https://t.co/X0uniIQm2o

@bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes totally, our rivers are in a mess and feels the should be protectors don't actually give a hoot. 
I'm in East anglia and have seen a massive decline over the years. The river waveny and wensum in particular

@greenarteries @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency Secondly the River Granta, current overall environmental health "Moderate" Reasons for not reaching 'Good' status attached. (2/3)

Obviously I'm curious how you can grade a river as 'Moderate' in 2019 when there was actually little if any water in? https://t.co/MQPjAcAUm6
